results.title: Nicholas Nickleby
results.creator_credit: Alberto Cavalcanti, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Features the British film production house Ealing Studios adaptation of the classic tale by Charles Dickens. Stars Derek Bond as Nicholas Nickleby, Sybil Thorndike as Mrs. Squeers, Sir Cedric Hardwicke as the steely hearted uncle and Stanley Holloway as the earthy thespian Vincent Crummels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alberto Cavalcanti, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios

results.title: Man in the white suit
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A scientist, played by Alec Guinnes, invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out. Unions and management are equally perturbed by this and endeavour to prevent its manufacture. Academy Award nomination for scripting.

results.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
When an antiquated railway line is threatened with closure, the villagers decide to run it themselves, entering into frenzied competition with the local bus route. Stanley Holloway as Mr Valentine, the village soak, becomes the railway benefactor and sets the wheels in motion. The antics of this eccentric rural community will provide a comic treat, while train lovers will appreciate the quest to save an old steam engine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios

results.title: The Magic scarab: superstition
results.creator_credit: Marshall Izen and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
This film uses a puppet story to explore the fallacy of belief in superstition, emphasizing self-reliance. It shows how Oni and the other puppets find out whether or not a good-luck charm really works when Oni reluctantly enters the spelling contest without it. Awards: two Emmy awards. Voices by Ruth Franklin and Marshall Izen. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Treasure hunt: teamwork
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents a puppet show story about teamwork on a treasure hunt in order to show the value of working together to meet a common goal.

results.title: Taffy's imagination: fear of the dark
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
One of a series of six Forest Town Fables, this film presents realistic explanations of imagined fantasies, so that darkness can be faced with confidence. It explains that Taffy is afraid of the dark until her puppet friends teach her their night game. It also shows how she discovers that things she saw and heard were imagined. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Celebrations: birthdays
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
A short program aimed at children aged 4-8 discussing the different aspects of preparing for and celebrating a birthday, comparing a traditional birthday party for an Australian child to a German and an Asian child. Also shows how people of all ages celebrate birthdays, and explains just what a birthday is.
